meanings.definition: The amount that a stage can hold or accommodate.
meanings.sent1: The theater was packed with stagefuls of excited audience members.
meanings.sent2: The concert hall was filled with stagefuls of cheering fans.
meanings.sent3: The school play had so many stagefuls of parents that some had to stand in the back.
meanings.sent4: The stadium was overflowing with stagefuls of enthusiastic spectators.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit attracted stagefuls of curious visitors every day.

meanings.definition: The quantity or number of items that can fill a stage.
meanings.sent1: The dance performance required stagefuls of colorful costumes and props.
meanings.sent2: The circus show featured stagefuls of talented performers and animals.
meanings.sent3: The magician's act included stagefuls of disappearing rabbits and birds.
meanings.sent4: The play production involved stagefuls of intricate set pieces and decorations.
meanings.sent5: The music festival showcased stagefuls of diverse musicians and bands.
